column6: At long last they have slopped speaking in phrases, at last the government is asking the people what they think, at last one can read the newspapers again, and perhaps at least even the political prisoners will see justice.

column6: An elderly gentleman tries to edge in with the argument that if Bondy refused such state contracts he would have to shut down his factory, and because he employs Czechs almost exclusively many of our people would be out of work.
column7: Jakýsi starší pán chce rovněž zasáhnout a řekne, že kdyby Levene takové státní zakázky odmítl, musel by asi zavřít továrnu, a protože v ní zaměstnává téměř výhradně naše lidi, přišlo by mnoho našich lidí o práci.

column6: Finally his stentorian roar alone fills the room and makes the house shake, and we cringe, for the acoustic effects of his voice are like the Chinese bell-torture.

column6: But the brothers would not apply the analogy to my case and so Brother Koran got pissed off, or rather was moved to wrath, but it was the wrath of the just, and he told them they were just the same as the Communists only on the other side of the spectrum, and now as far as I can tell he 's in the bad books of the Rosary brotherhood.

column6: " They sit around, safe and sound themselves, but a disproportionate number of civilians pay for it with their lives. "
column7: " Sami si seděj v bezpečí, a zaplatí to životem neúměrně velkej počet civilistů. "

column6: " Skocdopole was in danger, " I said.
column7: " Skočdopole teda v bezpečí neseděl, " řekl jsem.

column6: Events after the declaration of independence have confirmed this conviction. "
column7: Události během bojů po vyhlášení samostatnosti potvrdily tento úsudek. "

column6: " And is n't it true? " Sugar asks stubbornly.
column7: " A není to tak? " táže se vzdorně Sugar.

column6: I turn to the chairman, for he, as primus inter pares, will certainly reply.
column7: Obracím se k předsedovi, neboť ten jako primus inter pares jistě odpoví.
